L'actriu Adèle Haenel acusa el director Christophe Ruggia d'assetjament sexual
Els fets van passar durant la producció d''Els dimonis', quan l'actriu tenia entre 12 i 15 anys

04 Nov 2019, 12:42

L'actriu francesa Adèle Haenel, que acaba d'estrenar Retrato de una mujer en llamas, ha acusat el director Christophe Ruggia d'assetjament sexual, segons ha declarat al portal digital Médiapart. Segons la intèrpret, de 30 anys, els fets van passar fa més de quinze anys, durant la producció d' Els dimonis ( Les diables), el debut cinematogràfic de Haenel, que dirigia Ruggia. L'actriu ha explicat que l'assetjament va començar el 2001 quan va ser escollida per al paper, amb 12 anys, i es va allargar fins al 2004, quan en tenia 15. És a dir, va començar quan el director tenia 36 anys i es va acabar quan en tenia 39.
En un extens reportatge d'investigació, l'actriu relata que va patir "tocaments als malucs" i "petons no desitjats al coll", un comportament que descriu com un "assetjament sexual permanent". Tot va tenir lloc, continua, al pis del director i durant els viatges en festivals de cinema.
Haenel explica a l'article que va decidir fer pública l'acusació després de veure el documental sobre Michael Jackson Leaving Neverland, per denunciar "un sistema de silenci i complicitat que ho fa possible". Amb tot, no emprendrà accions legals contra Ruggia perquè creu que la justícia ignora les víctimes en la seva situació.
Una trentena de testimonis
Médiapart ha acompanyat les declaracions de l'actriu amb una investigació de set mesos amb testimonis d'una trentena de persones que en confirmen el relat. Una de les fonts del reportatge, una dona que va treballar a Els dimonis, afirma que les relacions entre el director i l'actriu, aleshores una adolescent, "no eren normals", i que a l'equip li semblava "que ella era la seva nòvia". Médiapart afirma que té documents que corroboren les acusacions de l'actriu, com cartes d'amor enviades per Ruggia a Haenel.
Ruggia ha negat les acusacions "categòricament" a través dels seus advocats. El comunicat del director afirma que ell i Haenel tenien una "relació professional i afectuosa", i qualifica el reportatge de difamatori. L'última pel·lícula estrenada per Ruggia va ser Dans la tourmente, del 2011; el productor del film, Bertrand Faivre, també apareix a l'article de Médiapart i declara que no tornarà a treballar amb ell.
text:
Actress Adele Haenel accuses director Christophe Ruggia of sexual harassment
The events took place during the production of 'The Demons', when the actress was between 12 and 15 years old

04 Nov 2019, 12:42

French actress Adele Haenel, who has recently released Portrait of a woman in flames, has accused director Christophe Ruggia of sexual harassment, according to the media portal Mediapart. According to the interpreter, 30 years ago, the events occurred more than fifteen years ago, during the production of The Demons (The Devils), Haenel's film debut, directed by Ruggia. The actress explained that harassment began in 2001 when she was chosen for the role, aged 12, and extended to 2004 when she was 15. That is, she started when the director was 36 years old and it was finished when I was 39.
In an extensive research report, the actress reports that she suffered from "touching the hips" and "unwanted kisses in the neck", a behavior that she describes as "permanent sexual harassment." It all took place, continues, on the director's floor and during trips to film festivals.
Haenel explains to the article that he decided to make the accusation public after watching the documentary about Michael Jackson Leaving Neverland, to denounce "a system of silence and complicity that makes it possible." However, he will not take legal action against Ruggia because he believes that justice ignores the victims in their situation.
Thirty witnesses
Médiapart has accompanied the statements of the actress with a seven month investigation with testimonies of about thirty people who confirm the story. One of the sources of the report, a woman who worked in The Demons, affirms that the relationships between the director and the actress, then a teenager, "were not normal," and that the team seemed "that she was his girlfriend ". Médiapart claims that he has documents that corroborate the accusations of the actress, as letters of love sent by Ruggia to Haenel.
Ruggia has denied the accusations "categorically" through her lawyers. The director's statement affirms that he and Haenel had a "professional and affectionate relationship," and describes the defamatory report. The last movie released by Ruggia was Dans la tourmente, from 2011; The producer of the film, Bertrand Faivre, also appears in the article by Médiapart and declares that he will not work again with him.
